page.title: 03WEASENHAM ALL SAINTS VILLAGE
page.content: The village of Weasenham All Saints is adjacent to Weasenham St Peter. The population is 139 and the total number of houses is 62. The houses are scattered apart from one section which is close to "St Peter's". Here is the "Reading Room" which is used as a meeting hall for both villages.Parish Council and Parochial Church Council meetings for both parishes are held here.This is the meeting place for Weasenham Women's Institute.The church and Weasenham Hall are to the south of the village.To the south of Weasenham Hall is a deciduous woodland which forms the beginning of the famous WEASENHAM AZALEA WOOD. Amenities are shared with St Peter'S. There is a twice daily coach service to London. The mobile library calls once a month. All Saints has a pub "The Ostrich",a telephone & post box.
